Class Screen

java.lang.Object
Screen
public class Screen
extends java.lang.Object
This class represents the screen. It controls the game.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Screen​(int windowSize, javafx.scene.Scene scene, javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc)
    Constructor that sets up the screen.

  • Constructor Details

    • Screen

      public Screen​(int windowSize, javafx.scene.Scene scene, javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc)
      Constructor that sets up the screen.
      Parameters:
      windowSize - the current size of the window
      scene - we want to add objects to this screen
      gc - the GraphicsContext that helps us draw objects on the screen

  • Method Details

    • initFood

      public void initFood​(Main.Difficulty difficulty)
      Initializes the foods based on the difficulty. (the number of them)
      Parameters:
      difficulty - the current difficulty

    • updateScreen

      public void updateScreen​(javafx.scene.Group root, javafx.scene.canvas.Canvas canvas, Main.Difficulty difficulty, javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc)
      Updates the content on the screen. Calls the functions and waits for a tenth of a second
      Parameters:
      root - the group that will contain the screen.
      canvas - we'll draw objects on this canvas using the GraphicsContext
      difficulty - the current difficulty
      gc - the GraphicsContext

    • resetScreen

      public void resetScreen​(javafx.scene.Group root, javafx.scene.canvas.Canvas canvas)
      Resets the screen by clearing everything from it.
      Parameters:
      root - the group that we want to clear
      canvas - the canvas that we want to put back into the group

    • isFoodCollision

      public boolean isFoodCollision​(Food food)
      Checks whether the snake ate a food
      Parameters:
      food - the food that might got eaten by the snake
      Returns:
      whether the snake ate a food or not

    • checkFoodCollision

      public void checkFoodCollision()
      Handles snake-food collisions

    • isWallCollision

      public boolean isWallCollision()
      Checks wall-snake collision
      Returns:
      whether the snake bumped into the wall

    • checkWallCollision

      public void checkWallCollision()
      If the snake hits a wall, the gameOver() function gets called

    • isSelfCollision

      public boolean isSelfCollision​(int i, int j)
      Checks the collision between two of the snake's tails
      Parameters:
      i - first tail
      j - second tail
      Returns:
      whether the tails collide

    • checkSelfCollision

      public void checkSelfCollision()
      If the snake eats it's tail, the gameOver() function gets called

    • drawBackground

      public void drawBackground​(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc)
      Draws the background of the screen
      Parameters:
      gc - the GraphicsContext

    • drawScore

      public javafx.scene.text.Text drawScore​(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc)
      Draws the score on the screen
      Parameters:
      gc - the GraphicsContext
      Returns:
      a Text which contains the score that we want to display

    • generateFood

      public void generateFood​(Main.Difficulty difficulty, javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc)
      Generates a food based on the difficulty Updates the foods' position Draws the foods
      Parameters:
      difficulty - the current difficulty
      gc - the GraphicsContext

    • relocateFood

      public void relocateFood​(Food food, Main.Difficulty difficulty)
      Relocates the food on the screen based on the difficulty.
      Parameters:
      food - this food will be relocated
      difficulty - this is the current difficulty

      public int getFoodCount​(Main.Difficulty difficulty)

      Parameters:

      Returns:

      Parameters:
